website_summaries.verdict: A durable, lightweight dry bag that will last you for many seasons to come.
pros: Adjustable straps and a handle for easy carrying
Sturdy bag that holds up well over time
cons: Must fold the bag over several times to seal it, reducing the usable space

customer_reviews.title: Dry Clothes > Wet Clothes
customer_reviews.text: The Adventure Lion Premium Waterproof Dry Bag does exactly what it is supposed to do! These bags are well built, I have purchased a 5L, 20L, and 40L. The larger bags come with additional shoulder straps which is a nice bonus. These bags have the best warranty in the industry which is well worth it when considering they are not any more expensive than any of their competitors products. Based on their construction I highly doubt I will need to use the warranty. Everything is kept nice and dry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and Durable Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable, practically puncture proof dry bags. I use a 40L and 30L as fish bags for the occasional slot sized red. As most know they have considerable spines in their dorsal fin. I have had no issues with any punctures after dozens of outings. Can’t say the say the same about the ones I’ve picked up at West Marine and Bass Pro Shops. Sorry fellas, but the Lion Dry Bag is the best!
customer_reviews.author: A. Kuhre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dry bag
customer_reviews.text: I used it on multiple whitewater trips (canoe, kayak, and raft), It survived all-day abuse at the bottom of boats and still looks brand new. It went into the river several times (once for over five minutes in a swamped canoe) and everything stayed bone dry inside the bag. Like all dry bags, you have to leave enough room at the top to give it three or four tight wraps before you buckle it.
customer_reviews.author: Rion Sanford

customer_reviews.title: If it’s inside it stays dry
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size for me I can throw in a set of clothes and a towel into this and keep it in my kayak. I also take this and put it in my hiking pack when I know I will be getting some rain and want to keep clothes or certain items dry I have had no issue with water getting in. The shoulder sling is a nice feature too makes it easier to carry around than some of the other options out there and makes it more versatile
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This truly reminds me of my Navy sea bag only it’s much better. I have a 40 Liter for packing all my snorkel gear and stuff for the day then lash it on my paddle board. It’s worked wonderfully. Super heavy outer is rubber and cleans up easily. Nice carry straps if u need them or the top heavy handle is nice when the top is rolled down. Sea bag improved! It’s actually waterproof !
customer_reviews.author: Basha

customer_reviews.title: Love my new bag!
customer_reviews.text: Super nice quality and a very large bag for the price. Haven't tested the water tightness but the seams and the bag material appear to be really nice and durable. Love that it comes with extra straps that can turn it into a backpack / day pack for the beach or whatever. Will be trying it out kayaking and on an upcoming Caribbean cruise. If it works out well I'll probably buy one in a smaller size as well. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: S. Atherton

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was quick and easy to use, no big fuss, though I wish I could've gotten one with backpack-type straps instead (was heavy with the towel and phones inside). No water inside with some light wading through waist-deep water, and was a nice attachment at the beach where you can easily see. Didn't try to submerge it at all, I don't think it's meant for that, but was fine against some basic splashing/floating on the water top.
customer_reviews.author: Fargo

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I just got off 16 days on the Grand Canyon and this dry bag held up to all the challenges (heat, sand, rapids, ...). I was a bit hesitant when I bought it because of the low price point but left all my belongings dry. The straps were heavy duty and the top held out the water and sand. Not as thick of material as the super expensive 110L NRS Bill's bag but also not $150+. I would buy this again. I bought the 40L size.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoe Dude

customer_reviews.title: worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: very nice..good size for taking a change of clothes, wallet, passport and phone etc plus a beach towel for 2!....would like a smaller one too to take ashore when just bringing wallet, passport and phone ...this looked a tad odd at dinner
customer_reviews.author: Anne W Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Over $500 of personal items ruined
customer_reviews.text: I had a horrible experience with this product! I went tubing with my friends yesterday and about one liter of water got into the bag and ruined my phone ($300) and my wireless entry fob for my car ($200). I even rolled the lid 6 times to make sure it was secure but that did not work. I do not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Would be given five stars but I really wanted a zipper and backpack straps and there are other packs that have those. Besides that it's a great bag to take on hikes, to the lake, swimming, etc. I tested having it fully submersed and it definitely starts letting water in if you do, which they say not to. It does float though if you close it right. On a side note I learned that ice cold water bottles can penetrate the waterproofness of the bag if they are leaned against the outside of it. The condensation builds up and seeps through. Design flaw? Or just science? Either way, it's kind of cool.
customer_reviews.author: teamredafro

customer_reviews.title: I love my purchase of the 20 L Pink adventure lion ...
customer_reviews.text: I love my purchase of the 20 L Pink adventure lion dry bag. Its really cute and light weight. My kayak tipped on its maiden voyage and the dry bag was trapped underwater under the hull of the boat for about 10 minutes. i was worried that every thing was going to be drenched... but to my surprise everything in the bag was bone dry. I like the look and light weight of the bag so much that I plan to use the bag to carry my stuff to the dog park, the dog bar, and dog beach and other outdoor activities. Why not its so cute light weight and convenient. Valerie K
customer_reviews.author: valerie k.

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the 5L bag. It looks pretty sturdy, but I expected a bit more interior space based on the company's description that this would fit phones, wallets and small towels for 2-3. Maybe you could fit 2-3 thin hand towels or washcloths plus phones and wallets. I took an average shorter beach towel rolled up and it was the only thing that would fit inside. This will probably work for my purposes though. I'll update when I actually use this on an upcoming trip.
customer_reviews.author: Girl Reading

customer_reviews.title: Survived class 4 rapids with ease
customer_reviews.text: Significantly better quality than any of my other dry bags. This bag is truly waterproof and kept my belongings dry even after being completely submerged. Handle and strap are very versatile for variety of outdoor activities. This version is very large size and cylindrical in shape which is a little awkward for packing but still a great bag. I will be purchasing the smaller size for day trips with less gear.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lennon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty ingenious closure mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Pretty ingenious closure mechanism, and the waterproof material appears thick and durable. I got this bag due to the reasonable price, stellar reviews, and useful size. Brought it to Cancun with me and couldn't be happier with it. The roll and clasp closure is quick and simple so you don't have to spend a lot of time futzing with it when you're on the go. The included nylon shoulder strap is comfortable and adjustable for almost any body type. Now I know that this bag does not guarantee complete dryness with prolonged submersion, but I floated 2 miles down a river with this strapped to my back, and nothing inside even got damp. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Skeletor

customer_reviews.title: they are great, and have kept our bags dry in a ...
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback that I've found is that the inside surface is almost sticky. When stuffing our sleeping bags in them for long winter backpacking trips, it's hard to get the sleeping bag all the way to the bottom of the dry bag. Other than that, they are great, and have kept our bags dry in a few big storms.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M Olsen

customer_reviews.title: This is a good, durable bag for a budget
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, durable bag for a budget. I bought it to keep stuff dry while kayaking, canoeing and general off-road Jeeping around in wet and muddy environments. It will hold a fair amount of dry goods to keep them that way.
customer_reviews.author: capncraigagain

customer_reviews.title: 3 abrasions on folded area ... I still loved it....
customer_reviews.text: No doubt . I loved it. There was just a small issue.. There were three severe abrasions on the fold. Probably due to prolonged storage in a folded state which almost reached the inside. I just strengthened it with a silicone sealant as I needed to use it ASAP and did not want the hassle of exchanging it. So far no leaks yet. Just did not look brand new now with dabs of silicone in three areas. Hopefully your people at the shipping and handling would do more quality control before items are shipped.
customer_reviews.author: FROISKY

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag!
customer_reviews.text: I use this fishing on the beach to store tackle, phone, etc. and it works great. It has stood up to some serious abuse and is still water tight. Would definitely recommend this bag. Update: I have had this bag for over a year now with heavy use. Still holding up well with no holes or leaks at the seams. This bag takes a lot of abuse being thrown in the kayak and tossed around while surf fishing. I am very impressed with how well this bag has held up.
customer_reviews.author: W Rhine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dry bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product if you are an avid outdoorsman. My brother had bought one on amazon and after using it numerous times, it was time for me to buy my own. You can use this at theme parks and what not to keep your stuff dry. I have not submerged this in water but I expect that it will keep your items dry. I use it on a 19 foot center console boat which sits low to the water(basically you get wet) I have never had any items in the bag even get damp or any salt on them from the air, which is a good thing because salt is unforgiving. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Vee

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dry bag to take with me to Kauai for a family trip. The bag is a great bag. I got the medium size and it was big enough to fit my Canon Rebel camera and lens. We also put many other stuff in it; protein bars, wallets, keys, small Sony camera, sunglasses. It worked pretty well. Once close, nothing goes in or out of the bag. The material seems durable. We use it for kayaking, snorkeling trip and to keep our bellowing dry while at the beach. I do recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: ypmay0323

customer_reviews.title: Amazing amazing Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing amazing Amazing! Took it river and waterfall climbing in Taiwan this weekend, the 20 L is much bigger than expected, but was able to fit multiple cameras, lenses, and camera equipment, plus food towels and extra clothes, with room to spare and air to help float across the river, Amazing product would buy 100 out of 100 times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag so far
customer_reviews.text: I would give these bags ( both the 20l and the 40l) a five star but I still have some testing to do. I had a really nice dry bag a long time ago, it was made of thick heavy material and it was sewn and glued together. These new bags from Adventure Lion do not seem to be as heavy duty. I am going on some rafting trips and before I go I am going to fully submerge the bags under water to see if things stay dry in them. After that and my rafting trips I will update things. I was given a discount for my honest review on both bags.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great for the boat!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to keep our gear dry while doing water sports. This bag doesn't disappoint. I use it to store my cell phone, wallet, towels, etc. to keep dry. I haven't had the bag in the water, but on the boat or land, it keeps everything bone dry! With today's high $$ cell phones, cameras, etc, you want to make sure they don't get wet, and the Ocean Lion bag does just that. It's a must have if you want to make sure your delicate electronics stay dry.
customer_reviews.author: Louc757

customer_reviews.title: Leave the air in the bag and it should work fine. Can't wait to use on the river
customer_reviews.text: It held much more than I was expecting. Although we didn't get to try out in the river due to storms when asked to write the review I tried it out in the bathtub and no water got in. I did read a few reviews before ordering that people said they leaked but I believe that must have been due to user error. They are really simple to use and you can't push the air out. Leave the air in the bag and it should work fine. Can't wait to use on the river.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

customer_reviews.title: hence it's not airtight and you lose storage space the more you roll it to make a better tighter seal
customer_reviews.text: Material seems waterproof. But you roll the top of the bag to make it waterproof... hence it's not airtight and you lose storage space the more you roll it to make a better tighter seal. This bag I would not recommend. I'm using it for gear in my kayak. If you want a good bag with storage the volume they say it can hold is misleading. This is not something I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size thanks to reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Was tempted to get the 5 L version, since that volume sounded plenty big for my DSLR camera + 2 reasonably sized lenses + passports, etc. But per other reviews, I decided to play it safe with this 10 L version. That was the right move, since once you fold down the top 3 times per the instructions that theoretical 10 liters is far less. So this fit my needs perfectly with little to spare, and the 5 L would have been a bust. Thanks Reviewers!
customer_reviews.author: Tx Photo

customer_reviews.title: but it looks terrific: stout
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet, but it looks terrific: stout, well made and designed. Question--larger sizes in same shoulder strap design? Mine is "10 liter." It seems that double, or more, volume would also be be great: clothes can be light weight but bulky. Also, a suggestion: non waterproof "net pockets," and/or "clips" for water bottles, drybag cell phone bags, tools, etc. Sewing through a waterproof fabric can be tricky at best. How about a "bag inside a bag" design, net/accessory "harness" encapsulating the basic waterproof bag?
customer_reviews.author: SoCalBill

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever for boating or the beach!
customer_reviews.text: We just returned from a trip of a lifetime in the Galapagos! We purchased 2 of the 20L Adventure Lion yellow bags. They were perfect for the twice daily trips from our ship to Zodiaks....off to either wet or dry landings on the different islands.....they worked perfectly, keeping all camera equipment, clothing, towels and shoes dry. One of the Naturalists admired our bags and asked to buy one from us. He didn't have access to purchase them in Ecuador, so we sold him one and we will buy another to replace it....for our cruise from Sydney, through the South Pacific, arriving in Hololulu. Perfect for boating, beach trips....anytime you want to protect your valuables.....
customer_reviews.author: Beachgirl Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof bag!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has been on several boating trips through Belize and has been very beneficial! All our important belongings (phones, wallets, etc) stay dry. The 20L was large enough to carry a bookbag holding 2 towels & hydroflasks. Lightweight & durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amira

customer_reviews.title: Works well for our needs.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. we take this bag paddle boarding. One of us usually wears it on our back while we are on the water. While we have not attempted to submerge the bag it has been floated on the water, our snacks and other items inside have stayed dry. this bag was affordable and is working well for our needs so far. It is not big especially after you roll the top down. We use it to carry snacks, sun screen, a small digital camera, and epi pens and there is still some room left over.
customer_reviews.author: 2 boysMama

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used the bag yet, but after looking ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the bag yet , but after looking it over carefully and seeing how well it's made, I'm sure it will live up to my expectations without any doubt. Well made,Thank You. I'm sure the 5 star rating I give it is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost High Performance!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly! Went out on the river all day and practically had this bag sitting and water with multiple phones and electronics inside. All came out completely dry at the end of the day. This bag is a God send! I definitely would love to buy more in bigger sizes. This one is just enough to fit the essentials but if you want a bag to fit clothes and shoes too I would go one size up :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: We went up to New Hampshire on rafting trip & needed something to keep phones, towels dry. Bought this from Amazon after reading reviews hoping this would do the trick. After a 6 hour trip down the river, this bag did its job. Everything was dry, not a speck of water got inside. We had even dumped the rafts a few times goofing around. If going on water trip & want to keep belongings dry, this is your bag!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: If you ever go to any water environment, get this!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and well made. Just throw your keys, wallet, magazines, in and have no worries. My friends go water in their boat from rain and a huge wake coming aboard. Their phone was floating in the water. Don't be in that situation and get this! I even travel with this. Lay it flat in a luggage and take it with you on rain forest hikes. I have even carried essentials to the airport with me with only this one bag. The straps are thick and don't chafe.
customer_reviews.author: ZenLife

customer_reviews.title: Description is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Description is misleading. 20 liter bag becomes considerably smaller after folding over to make it waterproof. Waterproof size is probably more like12-15 liter
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Adventure Lion Premium Waterproof Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: These bags worked great. We are new to kayaking and tend to get a bit of water on the kayaks when we paddle. The 40 gallon bag held a couple of beach towels, and two changes of clothes with room to spare. Everything in the bag was dry when we got done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daily Harbor Kayak and still dry
customer_reviews.text: I kayak to and from my sailboat in a harbor on average of twice a day (.5-1.5 miles total), and carry my laptop, tablet, phone and wallet in this dry bag. Rain, choppy seas, and one unexpected dump of the kayak and nothing has been wet yet. (When the yak dumped, the bag floated well, even with the 16" laptop in it.) My only recommendations are to put any items with sharp-ish corners in a sleeve, etc., and do not put loose items (keys and such) in the bag. My keys wore a hole in my first bag :( Now they stay in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Eric I

customer_reviews.title: Great design, Quality bag, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed and happy with this bag. The bag and the logo are beautiful designed. Excellent for the beach or boat trip. Comfortable to wear and walk around with. The 20L easily fits two beach towels, electronics (portable charger, phones, action camera), books, water bottles and lunch. The only concern I had was that the color is fading probably due to the exposure to the sun. Overall, this is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Kept Everything Dry
customer_reviews.text: This bag kept our belongings dry on water rides and around the pool. It was somewhat difficult for the kids to close properly but the adults had no problems. Be careful not to put anything wet/damp (one of the kids put a damp shirt in the bag) inside the bag as it will seal all the moisture in the bag and your other items will become damp also. The bag was pretty much as I expected and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Used to hold two peoples clothes for a 4 day kayak trip. Works well, great value! 40l is a lot bigger than I thought. Will be buying more for the rest of our gear.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Adventure Lion customer support should be improve
customer_reviews.text: After 3 diving trips with this back it started to leaking in the joint between bottom and lateral surfaces. I wrote and email to the manufacturer regarding the use of any recommended product to be used for repair this bag but after several weeks I'm still waiting for an answer. This is disapponting and even more considering they claim this is a lifetime warranty product- PS:I repaired the hole in the seam with aircraft integral fuel tank sealant PR-1422 and has worked very well so far
customer_reviews.author: Juan Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Wise investment!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this at the last minute for vacation and I am so glad I did. My kayak tipped over and this bag stayed afloat and kept everything dry. Could have lost my husband’s wallet, car keys, phone etc. I also would take my nice DSLR to the beach and kept it in this bag when I wasn’t using it and it was protected from sad. Inexpensive purchase that saved my a lot of money and time in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Neko

customer_reviews.title: Great Product But Too Small
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well made and keeps things dry but needs to be larger. I bought it to keep a few essentials aboard and dry while sailing my catamaran. I'd like to fit keys, wallet, cell phone, sunscreen, a bath towel, and maybe a sandwich in there but that isn't going to happen. It might all fit if I use a face towel but that won't do much good at drying me off when I get doused really well. (catamarans are notoriously wet boats)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase. I had been looking for something to ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I had been looking for something to keep a warm layer, a towel and some snacks snug and dry on the kayak. The size of this bag is perfect. Large enough to squeeze more than enough stuff for the day, but easy to carry with the handy strap. It tucked into the kayak perfectly, and everything stayed dry. Plus, the adorable lion on top smiled his way down the river. If you are looking for a great day adventure dry bag, this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: extremely high quality and excellent construction. Its really built to last and its ...
customer_reviews.text: extremely high quality and excellent construction .Its really built to last and its design is also well engineered .i really am happy with this dry sack and wont ever need to switch companies not when they are built like this ....with the life time warranty, a hint products that carry a life time warranty are almost always built to last...they know you'll never need to use it !!!!
customer_reviews.author: gary sachs

customer_reviews.title: These type of bags are great to stuff in your luggage or backpack for occasional ...
customer_reviews.text: These type of bags are great to stuff in your luggage or backpack for occasional use. Empty, it takes up almost no space. In use you don't have to worry about throwing it in the bottom of a boat with water in it, or getting wet in the rain. Recently went to Riviera Maya. We went on a couple excursions that included boating, and 4 wheeling. This was the perfect bag. I also bought the larger yellow one. Happy with both.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag!
customer_reviews.text: I get most all my camping stuff in this bag and it has never failed to keep everything dry. Very good product!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Your belongings stay dry and secure while slung on your back
customer_reviews.text: This Dry Bag with the ingenious shoulder strap was the envy of other travelers on the cruise in the Galapagos Islands. On the wet landings off the zodiacs, I was confidently hands-free, knowing my camera and towel were secure and dry. At home I never leave for a kayak or SUP day out without it. Even my son who is a river guide is envious.
customer_reviews.author: luvboox

customer_reviews.title: Great bag design with the strap
customer_reviews.text: Great bag design with the strap, comes in very handy for active sports. This is the perfect size for your DSLR camera, a book, a snack - whatever you need to stash for a trip. I also use it while swimming alone - pop your clothes, keys, wallet in here, sling it over your shoulder and let it trail while you swim laps on a public beach.
customer_reviews.author: tosh_enta2

customer_reviews.title: The bag looks great. it looks like the seems are welded
customer_reviews.text: The bag looks great. it looks like the seems are welded, rather taped... most of the less expensive bags are taped. Going on a cruise and i will update after the cruise, the stars could go up or down
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product. There were 4 of us kayaking this weekend and we had phones and car keys in this. I strapped it to my boat and everything stayed dry after I flipped going over a dam and the bag stayed submerged for a few minutes. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne Malone

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have the 10L dry bag, and find the size to be perfect. It is just the right size to carry a towel, a change of clothes, some of my dive gear, my cell phone, and wallet. I love being able to take this a loan out on a dive boat, and not worry about anything getting wet at all. I also love the strap that can go around your body, making it the perfect day trip companion.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren12787

customer_reviews.title: Good for the value
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tested the item yet but it appears like it will definitely do the job. I am just bummed that I didn't get the 20L. This one looks like it can hold electronics and one set of change clothes (if packed real tight). Definitely will consider getting another for my husband. Also, the color is more olive green than the lime in the picture. I was wanting something bright in color so that it could be easily spotted if it fell out of my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift  -
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dry bag as a gift for my friend who frequently kayak's. Previously, she was using a colman beverage cooler to transport her phone and other personal items. She has not used the bag yet, but loved the color and style. When she uses it, I will write back about the quality. Just a note, the color looks to be fuchsia on the purchase page, however, the color is more bright pink.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Bag is easy to use and seems well made
customer_reviews.text: Bag is easy to use and seems well made. The strap is long enough (and adjustable) so I can wear either on my shoulder or across my body. Used it today (across the body) when stand up paddleboarding. Stored my keys, waterproof camera, neoprene hat, gloves and jacket in case I needed it on my voyage.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good but smallish.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good bag so far. It is a very good design and seems to be durable and well made. It worked just great the one time I have used it so far. It kept everything in it dry when our canoe capsized. However, it is not very big, about the size of a ladies handbag. It appears to be the only size this company makes, because I also needed a larger one and looked on their website and on Amazon for one, and could only find this one size.
customer_reviews.author: Maikerum

customer_reviews.title: Saved my camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this bag, you really can't go wrong buying it! I bought this bag for my trip to the Amazon Rainforest to keep my DSLR camera dry. One day we were out on the river on a open boat and it started raining very heavily. In total I was out in this huge rain storm for about 2 hours and my camera stayed perfectly dry. I on the other hand was completely soaked, even with fancy waterproof cloths on.
customer_reviews.author: angus milne

customer_reviews.title: wow great product
customer_reviews.text: work great, bought three more perfect for my boating needs here inthe Keys
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Hill

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a very good product
customer_reviews.text: I received the bag within 2 days of ordering - the usual excellent service from Amazon. I am only giving the bag 4 stars because I have yet to use it in the rain. Purchased it for motorcycle travel. The useable size of the 20L (after top is rolled 4x for closure) is approximately 12" tall x 12" wide x 8" diam. It appears to be very well built and weather tight. Looks like it is designed well for its' purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time as advertised and as described. This ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time as advertised and as described. This dry bag feels very durable yet flexible. I will be using this bag this weekend while on a 12 to 14 mile paddle in relatively calm conditions. Looking forward to several years of reliably dry service for food. Next bag will be for clothing and critical supplies. Thank you Marc
customer_reviews.author: Marc Gillmore

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Price and bag quality is great,however....I had no idea what size 10 liters was(my bad) AFTER I ordered it,then I googled it. So it's about the size of a 2 gallon bucket. I was looking for a 5 gallon bucket size,which is the 20 L. So,it will do for camera protection and littles. My old bag got soaked in Automotive coolant by accident and the big bag I can store my pfd in. Otherwise great bag!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Great Dry Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Seller got my purchase to me in great shape and in a timely manner. The bag worked great on our camping trip! Would recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t receive shoulder strap
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. The only complaint is we didn’t receive the shoulder strap with it. Bag still functions fine and we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nothing drowned.
customer_reviews.text: How does it fit? That's an odd question. It's a dry bag. Its a little small for me, but it kept all my stuff dry and that's really the point isn't it? I'd have to buy a much larger one if I wanted to get in it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Delivered quickly. We bought this for our son to ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quickly. We bought this for our son to use to keep his clothes and electronics dry during swim meets. While he hasn't received it yet (Christmas present), we've played around with it and it looks simple for a kid to use and feels very durable to hold up to the abuse it's likely to endure.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great and dry
customer_reviews.text: Since you do not wear the bag, how this fits is interpreted as how well it fit the items I put in the bag. For me, this bag was excellent to hold my camera, a towel and some sun block. It did not leak and I used it a number of times during a snorkeling trip to the Bahamas. I liked the bright color as it was easy to see it no matter where I put it on the beach or on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. Just the right size to keep a wallet, keys, phone (and more) to take to the pool without anything getting wet. I bought it for paddleboarding, but haven't taken it out yet. Great price and great quality. I like that the straps can be adjusted for different ways of carrying the bag.
customer_reviews.author: hbmunchen

customer_reviews.title: This seems like one tough bag so far
customer_reviews.text: This seems like one tough bag so far. Tested the Sea Lion dry bag in the bathtub first--as would recommend with any waterproof protection before using it in the wild. Passed A+. Since then, only used the Sea Lion 10L once on a kayaking trip, but this bag seems as tough as they get, and look forward to using it every time I'm in a marine environment. Please let me know when you have a 20L... I'll buy it!
customer_reviews.author: And go...

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. Now I need to buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag three times kayaking and I just noticed two tears in the back of the bag. I didn't notice if they came that way or not. This bag is clipped on to bungee cords in the back of my kayak so that wouldn't have caused the tears. So disappointed. Now I need to buy another one. Going to buy from a different company I think.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia S.

customer_reviews.title: Kept everything dry!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this on a 9 day, 6 amusement park, 4 state and 2 country road trip with my son. We bought it just for this trip so we didn't have to store it on the water rides. It got drenched and dropped in water but kept everything inside dry as a bone. It is huge and will store 2 sling bags with hats and sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Bags!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 20ltr for all day Paddleboard trips, 40ltr for overnight trips. Durable, lightweight, strong. and WATERPROOF. Best bags I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: The bag was smaller than I expected. At first, I thought it would be too small for my kayak adventure. I was wrong! This bag was just perfect! It held a long-sleeve shirt, sunscreen, bug spray, two bottles of water, my waterproof camera, lip balm, and some snacks! It fit perfectly in the hatch of my kayak. I love the shoulder strap!! It's really well-made. I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof seal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several different brands and this one was the best. It has extra plastic around the rim to create a great a great waterproof seal. I love the bag and color.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Going canoeing
customer_reviews.text: Love the backpack straps on it. Can’t wait to use it for portage situations.
customer_reviews.author: 101sm

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity!
customer_reviews.text: It accomplishes what I purchased it for...keeping things dry.It is simple to use and can be anchored to most anything, I use the built in handle of my yak. I dislike the closure on some of these waterproof bags but this one is easy and fool proof Just roll and buckle,,, easypeasy. I should have gotten a size larger to handle a towel but I am happy with this item : )
customer_reviews.author: A. Farren

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for a cruise. We used them to keep a change of clothes and camera dry on multiple excursions. They kept the items inside 100% dry on repeated uses. If you need to keep your items dry, I highly recommend these!!! Be sure to fold the bag over 4 times as the directions say. I'm sure these will see future use!
customer_reviews.author: conservative dad

customer_reviews.title: So far it's kept our stuff 100% dry
customer_reviews.text: We've used this a couple times out on the lake and so far it's done a great job of keeping the water out. The color is nice, the material is sturdy and it doesn't look like it's prone to fine cracking because the material is too thick to fold over too far. All in all very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: USC Fan #34

customer_reviews.title: The ten liter size was perfect for carrying small items such as a 35 mm ...
customer_reviews.text: The ten liter size was perfect for carrying small items such as a 35 mm camera. Reading reviews on dry bags seems to show that all will leak if not properly secured. Nothing is foolproof around fools.This bag was of high quality and the strap makes it easy to carry and go.
customer_reviews.author: Delmere

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Bag survived class II and III rapids, kept contents dry and floated nicely when we were dumped. Held up better than the bag we were provided by the rafting company. Really impressed with the quality and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eads

customer_reviews.title: A must have on the water!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and very effective. Just learning to ride and started in the rough seas. So I flipped my board several times and nothing ever got wet inside. I opened and sealed it multiple times as well and love the design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my kayaking trips
customer_reviews.text: Great for my kayaking trips, I have these in all sizes and they keep everything dry and they do float.
customer_reviews.author: 2007 BEACHBUM

customer_reviews.title: Trust This Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: Used canyoneering in San Rafael Swell, UT. Worked flawlessly. I was in and out of water for 8 hours. 2 others in my group had "Sea to Summit" dry bags which are a thinner (possibly more light weight) material, but both ended up with wet clothes and food. This bag is thick and durable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Whipit

customer_reviews.title: I got the 10 gallon and I will tell you This was the best thing in the world on our excursions
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for a cruise! I got the 10 gallon and I will tell you This was the best thing in the world on our excursions! Keeps sand and water out of everything! Loved the color I got pick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is Obvious
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 20L bag. Oh Man, it is better quality than I expected. Oh yea, waterproof. Shoulder strap is ideal and handle carry is tough. No doubt will add a few more of these superb bags to my gear pile.
customer_reviews.author: Beerfarm

customer_reviews.title: great waterproof bag for snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: Great bag and waterproof, perfect for snorkeling. I took this bag out to Maui, honolua bay and snorkeled with this bag strapped to my back messenger style and I did not even notice I had it on. I had my wallet, rental car keys, sunglasses and kindle while snorkeling and they came out dry! Only thing i would have liked is an optional back style dual strap.
customer_reviews.author: Curious George

customer_reviews.title: A product to be proud of...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag to keep gear dry (sleeping bag,etc) in my Bug Out Bag. Living in the PNW where rain comes down for days and days at a time, I have to be sure my gear stays dry. Haven't had to use it yet (thank goodness because that would mean an earthquake or tsunami) but the test I did at home in the bathtub left everything safe and dry as expected. Great quality, roomy bag, prompt service. Would recommend to all as a product worth it's money and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: gryhndmom

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boat that's where I live so extra coverage for important things to be protected. But I took it on a trip to Tahiti as an extra bag and soooo glad I used it everywhere to protect my camera and things I would buy. I kayaked everyday and it was nice to take photos of the sunset and over the water cabins from the water :) super durable and I live the added d rings for a padlock so if I had to check it in no one could open it great bag I'll be getting other sizes :)
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for what I needed. can withstand a lot of punishing adventures, completely water tight if used correctly, and easily washed and cleaned if needed. shoulder strap is strong, and overall construction is strong. Will last me for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Used it in Maui (snorkeling) and surfing and it worked just great. No water came through the bag
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. Used it in Maui (snorkeling) and surfing and it worked just great. No water came through the bag. I had my car keys and cell phone in the bag and they both stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Lauryn Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice water tight bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Well built. Definitely water tight. About the only issue is that you need to roll the top over and over then buckle the strap to make it water tight. That reduces the storage capacity of the bag. Good for a small package - maybe a change of clothing - but it really doesn't have a lot of capacity. Otherwise you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for a snorkel trip and ended up using it everyday. It is perfect for the beach and around the pool.The roomy size fit a towel, sunglasses, phone, small wallet, and magazine. The handy carry strap is versatile. Contents inside the bag were secured by a clasp that worked well. I was surprised that it was so useful!
customer_reviews.author: nonfiction reader

customer_reviews.title: Must have bag.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a must have for out door use. If you have ever been out in it than you know stuff gets damp and wet. This bag keeps it all together is a sturdy safe environment. I am glad to have this now and will have whenever I am out doing it out in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Strong

customer_reviews.title: Good dr bag
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit smaller than what I thought it would be. When sealed it seems to be about the same size as a gallon of milk which is quite large enough for what I bought it for. However, it does store easily, and it appears to be constructed well. Overall very good product.
customer_reviews.author: El-Dave-O

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great Bag. We used ours all through waters of Nicaragua from one island visit to another. Pangas were our transportation with most uncovered. Lots of rain and still Nothing got wet inside. Easy to wash and sanitize. Light enough to allow for the heavier stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Marta P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Waterproof Bag - perfect size for small items.
customer_reviews.text: Great waterproof dry bag. I have one for each of my three boats, for storage and organization of boat keys and lift controls, and then for those things I bring out on the boat (keys, cell phones, etc.). The 5L is just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Urquhart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I use it to put in my mountain ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I use it to put in my mountain biking gear after rides (VERY DIRTY, muddy and dripping wet....). It holds all of it (shoes, shorts, shirt, knee pads, shin and elbow guards, Camelbak, gloves, helmet....). 100% waterproof, no dripping. Allows me to keep my car clean.....Really, really great.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Castillo

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product!!! I climbed Dunn's River Falls in Jamaica with my camera inside the bag. You climb 695 vertical feet in the waterfall. There are places where the water was up to my chest and it was getting splashed throughout the climb. I was pretty nervous when I opened the bag at the top. There was NOT ONE DROP of water in the bag!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag!
customer_reviews.text: High quality dry bag at a very reasonable price! Just put your valuables or items you want to keep dry in here and don't worry about a thing. Would be great for kayakers, or paddlers, even divers who want to keep their change of clothes dry during their dives. Any water person will appreciate this dry bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean, stays closed, and keeps things dry!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for soiled cloth diapers. It has held up great over the last year. My sitter does not dump the pooh it all goes into the bag for me to clean at the end of the day and I never smell the diapers when the bag is closed. It also cleans well I just wipe out the inside or rinse with warm soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: sean budgin

product_meta.title: Adventure Lion Premium Waterproof Dry Bags for Kayaking, Camping, Boating | 5, 10, 20, 40L
feature_bullets: WATERPROOF GUARANTEE - These heavy duty Dry Bags are the toughest on the market. Crafted with a solid roll top closure from state of the art materials, they stay soft and flexible even in the coldest weather. With years of proven reliability, Adventure Lion Dry Bags offer toughness plus comfort. Never lose track of your gear: These bags can float!

OUR LARGEST SIZE - At 40 Liters, these Dry Sacks are perfect to keep the whole family's gear safe and dry. Backed by a Hassle Free Lifetime Warranty, our customers venture with confidence, no matter how tough the elements get. This extra large Dry Bag offers maximim storage for families, camping, and outdoor professionals.

DUAL STRAPS FOR MAXIMUM COMFORT - Your 40L Safari Lion waterproof backpack comes with 2 extra long shoulder slings and a reinforced grab handle for easy carry and transport. With a Dry Bag backpack, adventures have never been easier!

RISK FREE ADVENTURES - All of our Dry Bags feature a Hassle Free Lifetime Warranty. Our South Carolina-based customer service team is ready to assist immediately via Amazon messages, direct email, or 24/7 phone support. Please note: if you plan on using this as a cellphone or iPhone waterproof case, waterproof camera bag, or waterproof bag for electronics, we recommend using another layer of protection for added security against damage and impacts

BUNDLE AND SAVE - Discounts When You Order TWO or MORE Adventure Lion Dry Bags TODAY - Get The Full Set Of 4 For 15% Off! See Our Promotions Below And Click "Add to Cart" To Purchase Your Brand New Adventure Bags NOW!
